channel.title: The Hon. Kerry Healey
channel.description: The Hon. Kerry Healey Former Lieutenant Governor of Massachusetts (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Ten years ago, as chairman of the Massachusetts Republican Party, I flew to Salt Lake City -- not to see the Olympics, but to meet the man who had saved them.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: I had a message from the grassroots: "Come back to Massachusetts. Our state needs you!"
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Mitt Romney had turned around companies and he had turned around the Olympics. Now Massachusetts needed Mitt Romney to turn us around.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Massachusetts was in deep trouble. We had a massive budget gap and soaring unemployment.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: People in my state were losing hope -- for themselves, their families and their children. Sadly, very much like our country finds itself today.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Mitt Romney answered the call of service and accepted the challenge.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: How did he fix our state?
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Well, he quickly assembled a cabinet of the best and the brightest, drawing on both parties, Republicans and Democrats, half women, half men, to give him the full spectrum of ideas and advice.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: He respected different opinions, valued open debate, and when it was all said and done, Mitt Romney knew how to make a decision.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Governor Romney did what many thought was impossible. He turned around a $3 billion budget gap and created a $2 billion rainy day fund. Even as he worked to streamline government, he made certain to safeguard protections for the elderly, children and the homeless.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: In education, Governor Romney gave parents more choices, insisted on tough standards for both teachers and students, and Massachusetts schools became the best in the nation.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: We cleared out regulations on small businesses. We cut taxes 19 times. And, as a result, unemployment dropped to only 4.7 percent.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: And, unlike President Obama, Governor Romney's economic policies were rewarded with a credit upgrade.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Those are the facts and figures, but when people find out that I served as Mitt Romney's lieutenant governor, they always ask me the same question: What's he like?
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: First and foremost, Mitt is a good and honorable man, committed to public service and his country.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: On the morning he took the oath of office, his first act was to focus public attention on those in need. We served breakfast to homeless veterans -- encouraging volunteerism, and acknowledging the special debt we owe to those who sacrifice for our country.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Mitt never took a salary as governor. But he worked harder than anyone I know.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Early every morning, before the rest of us arrived, Mitt would meet with his economic secretary. They worked tirelessly -- because for Mitt, creating jobs was his top priority.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Mitt was always a hands-on leader. When one of Boston's tunnels collapsed, tragically killing a passenger in her car, Mitt didn't blame others. He dove in and fixed the problem.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Mitt immersed himself in the engineering challenges, personally oversaw safety inspections, abolished cronyism and corruption, and restored public confidence.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: That's the Mitt Romney I know.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: And he is ready to bring that same work ethic, vision and integrity to the White House.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: He will never let our children's education be second-best or allow their future prosperity to be mortgaged by today's political cowardice. And he will respect those who build things with their own minds and their own hands.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Mitt Romney won't just talk about family values, he will live them.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: And I'll tell you another thing, Mitt Romney understands that the world is a safer place when our country leads, and he will never apologize for America.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: He will lead us back to an America we can be proud of -- and ahead to a future where the American dream is alive again, and within every man and woman's reach.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: Thank you, Mitt Romney, for believing in America.
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey

item.title: And America, you can believe in Mitt Romney!
item.author: The Hon. Kerry Healey
